did.unittitle: Presbyterian Center for Mission Studies records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Center for Mission Studies was an organization that supported the Worldwide Ministries Division of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. and cooperated with other affinity groups in the work of mission in the world. The Center, which operated out of Pasadena, California, was founded in the mid 1970s and was dissolved in 2005. After its dissolution, the Center's resources were folded into the Presbyterian Frontier Fellowship, in Richfield, Minnesota.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Presbyterian Center for Mission Studies. Materials include: newsletters from the United Presbyterian Center for Mission Studies/Presbyterian Center for Mission Studies, titled Missions Update or Mission Update, 1971-1997; a 1976 report by the organization titled "The Unfinished Task of Mission and Specific Opportunities for Involvement"; a book titled Let My People Know...and Go, 1996; a newsletter titled Mission Report by Matt and Millie Welde, 1992-1997; and one prayer letter, 1989. The collection also includes printed copies of email messages between Presbyterian Frontier Fellowship staff, 2000-2002. E-mails discuss seminars, logistics, and fund raising. Also includes drafts of articles and booklets, and reports. The e-mails were saved and printed by Larry Beckler of the Presbyterian Center for Mission Studies.
